description.narrative: Strengthened national and subnational human and institutional capacities to develop and deliver inclusive and equitable social- protection systems to strengthen the resilience of and protect boys and girls from all forms of poverty and social exclusion.

Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened national and subnational human and institutional capacities to develop and deliver inclusive and equitable social- protection systems to strengthen the resilience of and protect boys and girls from all forms of poverty and social exclusion.

description.narrative: In 2019, UNICEF strengthened policy advocacy and key partnership with MHDSTPA, ILO, WB and WFP, by organizing a comprehensive Assessment-Based National Dialogue to establish a Social Protection Floor. Major contributions towards development of a Multidimensional Poverty Index, with a focus on child poverty, were also achieved. Three Social Protection Conferences were organized (on Labour and SP, Shock Responsive SP, and Multidimensional Poverty), a SP performance and Expenditure Review undertaken, government staff trained on Participative Poverty Assessment including consulting children, and continued support to BOOST wrap-around model. As a result, UNICEF contributed to SP services provided to about 16900 children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2020

title.narrative: "Roadmap" -to develop a National Social Protection Floor/Strategy- agreed and being implemented, with UNICEF support
ILO-UNICEF Social Protection Performance and Expenditure Review finalized and with policy recommendations being acted upon to establish a national Social Protection Floor
1.1 National government measurement of child poverty using multidimensional measures
2.2 Policy/Strategy: Existence of valid national social protection strategy and/or policy
2.4 Coordination: Coordination mechanisms for social protection systems established countrywide
